description:
Primulina huaijiensis is a species of flowering plant in the genus Primulina, which is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is an herbaceous, perennial plant that is native to China, specifically found in the Huaiji County of Guangdong Province.

The plant has a rosette growth habit, with thick, succulent leaves that are obovate to spatulate in shape. The leaves are dark green in color and can grow up to 10 cm in length. The flowers of Primulina huaijiensis are typically blue or purple in color and are borne on a short, erect inflorescence.

This species is adapted to grow in shaded, humid environments, such as rock crevices or damp forests. It is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and over-collection for the horticultural trade. Conservation efforts are underway to protect this unique plant species.
